009package imagingbook.core.resource;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012import java.util.HashSet;
013
014import ij.IJ;
015import ij.ImagePlus;
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * Interface to be implemented by named image resources.
020 * This indicates (for testing) that the associated resource can be opened as
021 * an image (by ImageJ).
022 * Extends interface {@link NamedResource} by adding method {@link #getImage()},
023 * which returns an {@link ImagePlus} instance.
024 * By default, image files are assumed to reside in a directory at the same 
025 * level and with exactly the same name as the defining enum class itself.
026 * E.g., in a standard Maven-setup this is:
027 * </p>
028 * <pre>
029 * .../java/    .../bar/MyImageResource.java          = enum class implementing 'ImageResource'
030 * .../resource/.../bar/MyImageResource/image1.png    = associated image files
031 * .../resource/.../bar/MyImageResource/image2.tif
032 * .../resource/.../bar/MyImageResource/...</pre>
033 * <p>
034 * For example, given a named resource {@code MyImages.image1},
035 * this can be used simply in the form
036 * </p>
037 * <pre>
038 * ImagePlus im = MyImages.image1.getImage();
039 * im.show();
040 * </pre>
041 * <p>
042 * By default, resource file names are derived automatically from the
043 * enum item's name (by method {@link #autoName()}).
044 * If some other behavior is needed, method {@link #getFileName()}
045 * should be overridden.
046 * 
047 * @author WB
048 */
049public interface ImageResource extends NamedResource {
050        
051        public default ImagePlus getImage() {
052                return IJ.openImage(getURL().toString());
053        }
054        
055        @Override
056        public default String getFileName() {
057                return this.autoName();
058        }
059        
060        
061        static final HashSet<String> ValidImageExtensions = 
062                        new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList("png", "tif", "tiff", "jpg", "jpeg"));
063        
064        /**
065         * <p>
066         * Derives and returns a filename for this resource item to be used in
067         * parameterless enum constructors. By default the file name is identical to the
068         * name of the enum constant supplemented with a ".png" extension. No separate
069         * file name needs to be supplied. A different file extension may be specified
070         * by having the enum name end with an underscore followed by a valid image file
071         * extension, that is, "png", "tif", "tiff", "jpg", or "jpeg". In this case, the
072         * last underscore of the enum name is replaced by a '.' character to form the
073         * file name. (Note that '.' is no legal character in a Java identifier, thus
074         * cannot be used for the enum name directly.) If the last underscore is not
075         * followed by a valid extension, the default case is assumed ("png").
076         * </p>
077         * <p>
078         * Examples:
079         * </p>
080         * <pre>
081         * enum DummyNamedResource implements ImageResource {
082         *      a,
083         *      A_png,                          // A.png
084         *      foo_tif,                        // foo.tif
085         *      foo_tiff,                       // foo.tiff
086         *      The_File_jpg,           // The_File.jpg
087         *      The_File_jpeg,          // The_File.jpeg
088         *      _Some____File_bla;      // _Some____File_bla.png
089         * }
090         * </pre>
091         * 
092         * @return the derived image filename
093         */
094        public default String autoName() {
095                String itemname = this.toString();
096                int k = itemname.lastIndexOf('_');
097                if (k >= 0) {
098                        String filename = itemname.substring(0, k);
099                        String extension  = itemname.substring(k + 1);
100                        if (ValidImageExtensions.contains(extension)) {
101                                return filename + "." + extension;
102                        }
103                }
104                return itemname + ".png";
105        }
106        
107
108
109
110}
